textBox.richText: On Friday, Sept. 18, Aaron, Matt, and I did a quick (1 hr 40 min) ride at American Fork Canyon. We did a loop that included dropping down into Mutual Dell in Bear Canyon, which has a bunch of gnarly (& fun!) tight switchbacks on the downhill trail, and several on the uphill one. Unfortunately, Matt suffered damage to his handlebar while negotiating one of the switchbacks. It made for a rather uncomfortable riding position back to the truck! On Tuesday, Sept. 22, Gene & I went for a ride in American Fork Canyon. This time we did trail 038, which has the reputation of being the most difficult trail up there. I haven’t ridden it in 3 years. Since then someone has re-routed the most difficult section of the trail to avoid some bad uphill roots, and the downhill switchbacks have mellowed out a bit so they are not as difficult as the ones down into Mutual Dell. Gene: Trail 039 on our way over to 038 Turnoff to Trail 038. Yes, it’s steep! Looking down into Heber from 038 We’ve just come down the switchbacks (which you can’t see up on the slope in this view) Now we’ve crossed Poleline Pass and are on Trail 157. This is one of my favorite pictures. We went down some more steep switchbacks, then did the climb up to Sunset Peak. View down into Brighton (Park City side of the mountain) We had a great ride--3 hours and around 37 miles. The single track in AF Canyon is just amazing, as is the scenery!
